newsitem.title: ROMANIA: EBRD to give $100 mln to Romania telecom firm.
newsitem.headline: EBRD to give $100 mln to Romania telecom firm.

text.p: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) plans to invest $100 million to support the privatisation of Romania's Romtelecom telephone utility, a senior EBRD executive said on Wednesday.

"The target is that this project will be basically approved sometime in September," Director Josue Tanaka told a news conference. "The size of the investment of the European Bank is about $100 million."

Romtelecom, which has a monopoly on telephone services in Romania, announced ambitious privatisation plans which it expects to complete in early 1998. Privatisation of Romtelecom could attract up to $4.0 billion, official estimates say.
This year the EBRD had already commited $310 million to fund projects in Romania's infrastructure, Tanaka said.

Of this amount $45 million went to a thermal heating rehabilitation project for five Romanian cities, $190 million to the recently launched MobiFon mobile telephony firm and $75 million to a project related to water works and environmental improvements in another ten cities across Romania.

Latest data showed the EBRD portfolio for Romania was $1.05 billion in January. Of this, around 60 percent were allocated to support the public sector while the rest was used to fund projects in the private sector.

"The key element of our strategy here is to reverse the ratio between public and private sector investment," Tanaka said, adding that the EBRD's future projects this year would focus on direct private sector financing.
